learnings.title: Auth Service Staging Deployment Fixes
learnings.summary: Successfully diagnosed and fixed multiple issues preventing auth service from running in staging environment.

issue.root_cause: Docker build was not copying auth_core module to root level where imports expected it
issue.solution: Updated Dockerfile.auth to copy auth_core to both locations: - COPY auth_service/ ./auth_service/ - COPY auth_service/auth_core/ ./auth_core/

issue.problem: Redis connection failures in staging: "Error 111 connecting to localhost:6379"
issue.root_cause: Auth service trying to connect to Redis on localhost in staging environment
issue.solution: Implemented environment-based Redis disabling in session_manager.py: - Auto-disable Redis when ENVIRONMENT=staging - Graceful degradation to JWT-only authentication - Health checks report healthy when Redis intentionally disabled

issue.problem: Port mismatch causing health check failures
issue.root_cause: Cloud Run health checks targeting port 8080 but service running on 8001
issue.solution: Updated deploy-staging-reliable.ps1 to use correct port: - Changed --port from 8080 to 8001 - Ensured consistency across deployment configuration

issue.root_cause: JWT secret not being passed to auth service in deployment
issue.solution: - Created jwt-secret-staging secret in GCP Secret Manager - Updated deployment to include JWT_SECRET_KEY in --set-secrets

issue.root_cause: Incorrect database credentials in database-url-staging secret
issue.solution: Need to update database-url-staging secret with correct PostgreSQL password

learning.title: Module Path Dependencies
learning.description: Python imports in microservices need careful attention to module paths. When splitting services, ensure Docker builds maintain expected import structures.
learning.recommendation: Always test Docker builds locally before deploying to staging. Consider using relative imports within service boundaries.

learning.title: Environment-Specific Service Dependencies
learning.description: Services should gracefully handle missing dependencies in different environments. Redis not needed in staging but critical in production.
learning.recommendation: Implement environment-aware initialization for all external dependencies. Use feature flags or environment variables to control optional services.

learning.title: Cloud Run Port Configuration
learning.description: Cloud Run health checks must target the exact port the service listens on. Port mismatches cause 503 errors even when service is running.
learning.recommendation: Standardize port configuration across Dockerfile, deployment scripts, and service code. Use environment variables for port configuration when possible.

learning.title: Secret Management Consistency
learning.description: Secrets must be consistently named and referenced across services. Missing secrets cause silent failures that are hard to debug.
learning.recommendation: Create a secret management checklist for new service deployments. Use descriptive secret names that indicate their purpose and environment.

learning.title: Error Message Clarity
learning.description: Empty error messages make debugging extremely difficult. TimeoutError with no context doesn't indicate password vs network issues.
learning.recommendation: Always include context in error messages. Log connection strings (with passwords masked) to aid debugging.

deployment_checklist.step: Verify Docker build includes all required modules
Check port configuration matches across all layers
Ensure all required secrets exist in Secret Manager
Verify database credentials are correct for environment
Test health endpoints locally before deployment
Monitor logs during initial deployment for startup errors
Verify min-instances set to at least 1 to avoid cold starts

terraform_management.overview: Infrastructure for auth service secrets is managed via Terraform in terraform-gcp/auth_service.tf

secret.name: jwt-secret
secret.description: JWT signing secret for authentication tokens

service_account.name: auth-service-sa
service_account.permissions: - roles/secretmanager.secretAccessor for all auth service secrets - Automatically granted via google_secret_manager_secret_iam_member resources

deployment_process.step: 1. Update variables in terraform.tfvars with DATABASE_URL containing correct password
2. Run terraform plan to verify changes
3. Run terraform apply to create/update secrets
5. Service automatically pulls secrets using service account permissions

important_notes.note: The database-url-staging secret is conditionally created only in staging environment. This prevents accidental production secret overwrites.
Service account permissions are automatically managed via Terraform IAM bindings. No manual permission grants needed.
DATABASE_URL variable in terraform.tfvars must contain the full connection string including the correct password for the staging PostgreSQL instance.
